sentence.Network_en: It was easy to see why the cartoonists regularly portrayed him as a malign cherub.
sentence.Network_cn: 难怪漫画家总是把他画成一个邪恶的小天使.

sentence.Network_en: Tessa's face began to look as contented as a cherub's budding from a cloud.
sentence.Network_cn: 苔莎的脸开始像云端里初现的小天使那样的快活.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cherubin, ultimately (via Latin and Greek) from Hebrew kĕrūḇ, plural kĕrūḇīm. A rabbinic folk etymology, which explains the Hebrew singular form as representing Aramaic kē-raḇyā 'like a child', led to the representation of the cherub as a child

entry.tran: 小天使(艺术作品中常表现为带翼、裸身的孩子)
entry.def: A cherub is a kind of angel that is represented in art as a naked child with wings.

means.word_mean: 2. an angel of the second order whose gift is knowledge; usually portrayed as a winged child
